required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of HLD200 in Children and Adolescents With ADHD

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to assess the pharmacokinetic effects of a single dose of HLD200 (methylphenidate hydrochloride) in children and adolescents with ADHD.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study utilized a single-center, open-label, single-treatment, fasted design to examine the rate and extent of absorption of evening-administered HLD200 in children (6-12 years) and adolescents (13-17 years) with ADHD.
Following a screening period that included five days washout to allow for clearance of any prior ADHD medications, subjects were domiciled in-clinic and administered HLD200 (B-formulation; 54 mg; oral capsule) at 9 pm under fasted conditions. Subjects were then observed for safety and tolerability and a total of 18 blood samples collected during a 48 hour period (at t=0, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 18, 20, 22, 24, 36 and 48 hours post-dosing). These samples were then assayed for methylphenidate plasma concentrations and this data used for calculation of pharmacokinetic parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters for Rate and Extent of Absorption of MPH: Lag Time
primary_outcome.description: The absorption lag time for methylphenidate in plasma expressed in hours is the difference in time between the drug administration and the last time point where the drug concentration was below the limit of assay quantitation.

primary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters for Rate and Extent of Absorption of MPH: Cmax
primary_outcome.description: The maximum drug concentration of methylphenidate in plasma.

primary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters for Rate and Extent of Absorption of MPH: Tmax
primary_outcome.description: The time to reach maximum concentration of methylphenidate in plasma.

primary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters for Rate and Extent of Absorption of MPH: AUC0-tz
primary_outcome.description: Area under the methylphenidate plasma concentration-time curve to time point tz (AUC0-tz), where tz was the last time point over the time interval with a measurable drug concentration

primary_outcome.measure: PK Parameters for Rate and Extent of Absorption of MPH:
primary_outcome.description: The area under the methylphenidate plasma concentration-time curve to infinite time

other_outcome.measure: PK Parameters for Rate and Extent of Absorption of MPH in Plasma: Plasma Concentration-time Curve
other_outcome.description: To determine the rate and extent of absorption of methylphenidate following a single treatment of HLD200 (B formulation; 54 mg) in children and adolescents with ADHD, plasma samples were collected at t=0, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 18, 20, 22, 24, 36 and 48 hours post-HLD200 treatment and methylphenidate concentrations were determined.

arm_group.description: HLD200 (B formulation, 54 mg, oral capsules) administered as a single treatment in the evening to children aged 13-17 years.
HLD200 (B formulation, 54 mg, oral capsules) administered as a single treatment in the evening to children aged 6-12 years.

overall_official.affiliation: Centre for Psychiatry & Behavioral Medicine, Inc.

facility.name: Centre for Psychiatry & Behavioral Medicine, Inc.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 29 subjects were enrolled (18 adolescents and 11 children in sequential cohorts). Following consent/assent and screening procedures, subjects were required to wash-out of all ADHD medications for 5 days prior clinic admission for testing.

group.title: Adolescents (13-17yrs)
group.description: Drug: B-HLD200 54mg capsules (Methylphenidate Modified Release B Formulation) or Drug: C-HLD200 54mg capsules (Methylphenidate Modified Release C Formulation) B-HLD200 54mg capsules C-HLD200 54mg capsules

group.title: Children (6-12 Yrs)
group.description: Drug: B-HLD200 54mg capsules (Methylphenidate Modified Release B Formulation) or Drug: C-HLD200 54mg capsules (Methylphenidate Modified Release C Formulation) B-HLD200 54mg capsules C-HLD200 54mg capsules

group.title: HLD200 (Methylphenidate Hydrochloride) in Adolescents
group.description: HLD200 (B formulation, 54 mg, oral capsules) administered as a single treatment in the evening to adolescents aged 13-17 years.

group.title: HLD200 (Methylphenidate Hydrochloride) in Children
group.description: HLD200 (B formulation, 54 mg, oral capsules) administered as a single treatment in the evening to children aged 6-12 years.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
